# Violet Message Search Core

Toolkit for Searching Doujinshi Quotes

If you want to just using just message search engine, see https://github.com/project-violet/violet-message-search-local.

## Support

Currently, **korean** and **english** are only supported.

If you would like to support your language, please contact me.

This work takes about 3-6 months.

## Search Method

All methods are based on fuzzing searches. 
Even if only a part of the input word or sentence is included, even if there is a typo in the input word, it produces an appropriate search result.

 - `/similar/(.*?)`: Search for quotes similar to the input word or sentence.
 - `/contains/(.*?)`: Searches for quotes that contain the input word or sentence. Search results cannot be shorter than the search target quote.
 - `/lcs/(.*?)`: Search for quotes using the longest common substring algorithm.
 - `/wcontains/(<article id>.*?)/(.*?)`: Contains operation for quotes included in a specific article.

## How to use it?

### 1. Collect Source Data

You must collect source data from ocr of e-hentai articles before message search.
Check this `miner` sub-directory.
In `do-ocr.py`, easyocr lib is used for ocr.
To fast processing, consider using cloud gpu instances.

Follow example is the source data of 2282012.


### 2. Caching

Source Data is very dirty, so you need to clean it up.
`hcache` is simple to do this.
This tool filters out sentences with low accuracy and combines words that are close to each other to form a complete sentence that will fit into the speech balloon.

Follow example is the cache data of 2282012.

```json
[
  {
    "ArticleId": 2282012,
    "Page": 0,
    "Message": "dojin r18",
    "Score": 0.7390363678204988,
    "Rectangle": [
```

### 3. Merging Caches

`hcache-merger` is tool of merging caches.
This tool merges all cache information and splits it into one or two or more files.
A mandatory parameter of `hcache-merger` is information on how many merge files are split.
Sufficient search performance is guaranteed when the service is divided into at least three instances.
Even when running on a CPU with more than 64 cores (r5.metal, c5.metal, m5.metal), 
it shows lower search performance than running it by splitting it into three instances :(

### 4. Running

`fast-search` is the core program for message searching.
This tool quickly searches for speech balloons through a fuzzy string search.

A minimum of 2 Core CPU and 16 GB of RAM are required. For AWS, r5.large is recommended.
If there is not enough RAM, create a swap.

```sh
sudo su
mkdir -p /var/swap
dd if=/dev/zero of=/var/swap/swapfile bs=1M count=4000
mkswap -f /var/swap/swapfile
swapon /var/swap/swapfile
swapon -s
```

Then, download the split merge file from each instance and start the service.

```sh
sudo apt update -y
sudo apt install libgomp1 -y
wget http://1.2.3.4/htext/merged-0.json
wget http://1.2.3.4/htext/fast-search/build/fscm
wget http://1.2.3.4/htext/forever.py
mv merged-0.json merged.json
chmod 777 fscm
nohup ./fscm 0.0.0.0 8864 <your-onw-token> &
```

or using this.

```py
import sys
import os
import os.path
import time
import shutil
from subprocess import Popen, PIPE
from datetime import datetime

while True:
  process = Popen(['./fscm', '0.0.0.0', '8864', '<your-onw-token>'])
  process.wait()
```
